result.execSummary:
The defendant Travis A. Howard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Distrib. Hazardous Substance-Abuse Known [Modifiers: Conspiracy to Commit], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.316(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Travis A. Howard in court with attorney Thomas Clinton Roley.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls 14CF42 & 14CM43 @ 2:57 pm.  Plea advisement filed. State gives 14CF42, ct 1 plea, ct 2 Dismissed & read in, withheld sentence 2 yrs probation, Cooperate with Law Enforcement & provide truthful testimony with co-defendant,  AODA & follow through, cost, 45 days jail, 14CM43 ct1  plea & ct 's 2 & 3 & 4 Dismissed & read in,  withheld sentence  1 year probation, Restitution 448.38 & costs.  Complied with victim rights. Court reads victim impact statement in 14CM43.  Parties have reviewed impact statement.  Ct 1 in 14CF42, Distrib. Hazardous Substance, no contest plea. ct 2 dismissed consistent with plea agreement, 14CM43 Ct 1 Criminal Trespass, no contest plea, ct's 2, 3, & 4 Dismissed consistent to plea agreement.  Def. advised of constitutional rights & J.T. rights. Atty Roley factual basis & is satisfied. Court finds plea is freely & voluntarily given, accepts plea & finds def. Guilty in 14CF42 Distrib. Hazardous Substance, Conspiracy in ct 1 & 14CM43 Criminal Trespass in ct 1. Def. has nothing to say. Victim has nothing to say. 
Court accepts plea agreement & orders 14CF42, ct 1 withheld sentence 2 years probation, Cooperate with Law Enforcement & provide truthful testimony with questioning, AODA & follow through, costs & 250 DNA Surcharge, 45 days jail, huber privileges, c no later than 10-1-14 @ 6 pm.  Can be served in Dane Co. no electronic monitoring. DNA Sample, Court advised def. of firearm & voting rights. Bond to be applied to Restitution in 14CM43 to DA & costs & balance to def. 
14CM43 withheld sentence 1 year probation, Restitution $448.38 to Mr. Maciniak & costs & $200 DNA Surcharge.  Concurrent with 14CF42
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Def. advised of postconviction rights.
for Discovery and Demand for Inspection
No possession or use of bath salts.  No use of alcohol.  No contact with A. H.or J. M.

Defendant Travis A. Howard in court with attorney Thomas Clinton Roley.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 14CF42 & 14CM43 @ 3:13 pm.  Court vacates warrant.  Def. explained why missed court.  Atty Roley gives statement.  State moves to fofeit 14CM43 & don't forfeit bond in 14CF42.  Court will forfeit bond in 14CM43, $250.00 to Langlade County & bond in 14CF42 will be reinstated to cover both files w/same conditions.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 2, 2014 at 02:45 pm.

Attorney Thomas Clinton Roley in court.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 14CF42 and 14CM43 @ 3:13 p.m. Scheduled for 3:00 p.m. Atty Roley does not know why Def doesn't appear. State moves to forfeit bond in 14CM43 and asks for body only warrant. Court forfeits subject to hearing. State moves to forfeit bond in 14CF42 and asks for body only warrant. Court forfeits subject to hearing. Warrants will be state wide.

Defendant Travis A. Howard in court with attorney Thomas C Roley.  Ralph M Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 14CF42 and 14CM43 @ 10:04 a.m. Def will waive prelim hrg. on 14CF42, both to be set for status conf. Court reviews prelim rights, finds Def understands and waiver freely made. Probable cause found. Information filed. Copy received, reading waived, not guilty pleas. Court enters not guilty pleas to each count. Bond remains.  Status conference scheduled for July 14, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Travis A. Howard in court with attorney Thomas C Roley.  Jill L Laufenberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Cases called 14CF42 and 12CM43.  On CM not guilty plea entered.  CF Preliminary set   Time limits waived for preliminary.  CM set for status conf.  Bond will continue  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 26, 2014 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Travis A. Howard in court.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Def has copy of complaint.  Court reads charges with possible penalties.  Def advised of right to an attorney.  Bond will continue with conditions  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 28, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
